summary: OnlineLino is a website dedicated to the architectural work of Raul Lino da Silva or Raul Lino (1879-1974), which provides information on the architect's building legacy in the Médio Tejo region.
The portal provides entries for drawings, documents and images of the projects built and identified on site, as well as images, documentary films and a biography of the architect Raul Lino.

developed: OnlineLino is a website dedicated to the architectural work of Raul Lino da Silva or Raul Lino (1879-1974), which provides information on the architect's building legacy in the Médio Tejo region.

The building legacy of Raul Lino da Silva (1879-1974), a renowned Portuguese architect, is scattered throughout Portugal. His architectural projects for the city of Abrantes were studied in the research project “Raul Lino - an itinerary through the heritage of Abrantes” (RauLino| Abrt). This study revealed the need to aggregate, systematize and publicize his architectural projects for municipalities in the current Médio Tejo region, which are not sufficiently publicized or are not even associated with their author.

The project behind the development of the OnLineLino site was conceived at the R&D Center of the Polytechnic Institute of Tomar, Centro de Tecnologia Restauro e Valorização das Artes (TECHN&ART), in partnership with the Calouste Gulbenkian Foundation (FCG). The main aim of this partnership is to share and provide access to the documentation relating to Raul Lino's architectural estate held in the FCG's Art Library. The aim is to make available and aggregate the information scattered across different archives and sources, and to facilitate organized access to it.
This project was funded by the Foundation for Science and Technology under the CFPI2023/08 program.
The OnLineLino project was carried out by researchers from TECHN&ART and students from the Editorial Design Master's and Computer Engineering Degree courses at the Polytechnic Institute of Tomar.

biographyPage.generic: Raul Lino da Silva or Raul Lino (1879-1974) began his education in England and Germany, having attended the Handwerker und Kunstgeweberschule in Hanover, where he studied carpentry and furniture design, and the Technische Hochschule. He did his practical training in the studio of Professor Albrecht Haupt, who studied Renaissance architecture in Portugal. In 1897, he returned to Lisbon to begin what would become a long and productive career in architecture. His English and German experience placed him at the center of a culture that was reflected both in his architectural practice and in his various written publications, adjusting European learning to the nationalist program.
videosSubtitle: [Opening of the exhibition in 1970 at FCG]
biographyPage.about: The Médio Tejo is a sub-region located in the centre of the country. It includes the municipalities of Abrantes, Alcanena, Constância, Entroncamento, Ferreira do Zêzere, Mação, Ourém, Sardoal, Sertã, Tomar, Torres Novas, Vila de Rei and Vila Nova da Barquinha.

buildingsPage.title: Projects and Buildings
buildingsProjects: Raul Lino's architectural work is spread throughout Portugal. His architectural production has been the subject of several studies, with particular emphasis on the buildings constructed in Lisbon, Sintra and Cascais, namely the so-called “Moroccan houses”, built in the first decade of the 20th century.

In addition to his architectural legacy, Raul Lino is also the author of a number of written publications, including “A Nossa Casa - Apontamentos sobre o bom gosto na construção de casas simples”, 1918; “Casa Portuguesa”, 1929; “Casas Portuguesas - Alguns apontamentos sobre o arquitectar das casas simples”, 1933; “Auriverde jornada: recordações de uma viagem ao Brasil”, 1937; and “Quatro palavras sobre Urbanização”, 1945.
Raul Lino's architectural collection of more than 600 projects can be found at the Calouste Gulbenkian Foundation Art Library (CGAL).
buildingsPage.title2: Projects and Buildings at Médio Tejo
buildingsProjectsMedioTejo: Raul Lino received commissions for projects in what is now the Médio Tejo region. The first project identified is dated 1919 and refers to a house for José Serra da Motta, located at Rua Luís de Camões, in the urban center of Abrantes.

The CGAL's collection includes 33 architectural projects for the municipalities of the current Médio Tejo region, 23 of which are for the municipality of Abrantes, and the rest for Alcanena (1), Constância (1), Mação (1), Ourém (1), Sardoal (1), Tomar (3), Torres Novas (1) and Vila Nova da Barquinha (1). These projects correspond to new constructions, conversions and extensions of existing buildings, urban arrangements, tombs, schools, a building for the headquarters of a cultural and recreational club (link), a pedestal (link) for a statue and a tower for a transformer station (link).

The architect was commissioned to design the headquarters building of the Sociedade da Assembleia de Abrantes (link) by this local recreational club in 1923. Its construction was completed in 1924, but it was only inaugurated in 1928, and is currently property of the same society.
imagesSubtitle: House designed by Raul Lino (1919 project) located at Rua Luís de Camões in Abrantes (192?) [Credits: FCG].
Postcard of the headquarters building of the Abrantes Assembly Society (192?).

buildings.title: Residential Building, Abrantes
info: This house, located on the edge of the historic centre of Abrantes, was probably Raul Lino's first project in the city of Abrantes. It was the house/studio of José Serra da Motta (1883-1943), a lawyer and watercolour painter.

The property is located on a steeply sloping plot between Rua Luís de Camões and Rua do Montepio Abrantino. It has two floors and includes an attic. The building features a porch supported on five columns and facing west, dormer windows that provide natural light to the attic, two large chimneys decorated with red clay ceramic elements similar to those used in the staircase at the rear of the house.

The arrangement of those ceramic elements is replicated in other Raul Lino’s design details such as: the chimney of Sociedade da Assembleia da Abrantes headquarters (3), the fence of the house at Vila Nova da Barquinha (11), the balcony guard of the house in Rua do Arcediago, Abrantes (19).
The windows on the first floor are protected by shutters whose colour contrasts with the wall of the house, just like the Sociedade Assembleia de Abrantes headquarters built in 1924.
imagesSubtitle: Rear facade, (Arquivo Municipal Eduardo Campos, date: between 1969 and 2018)
View from Rua do Montepio Abrantino (2022)
Chimney and porche detail (2022)

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1919). Casa Unifamiliar, Abrantes. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 80.

buildings.title: Quinta da Fábrica Abrantes, Abrantes
info: The project developed by Raul Lino refers to an extension of an existing building called Quinta da Fábrica and was commissioned by the Soares Mendes family. The construction description confirms Lino’s concern on integrate architectural and constructive solutions within the pre-existing building.
imagesSubtitle: Location of Quinta da Fábrica (2022)
Quinta da Fábrica building (2022)

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1922). Casa Unifamiliar, Rossio de Abrantes. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 135.

buildings.title: Assembleia de Abrantes Headquarter, Abrantes
buildings.typology: Headquarters of cultural and recreational association (original plan)
info: The building, designed in 1923 to house the headquarters of the Sociedade Assembleia de Abrantes, was completed in 1924 and inaugurated in 1928. It currently remains the property of the Sociedade da Assembleia de Abrantes, that was established in 1920. This building is classified as “Monumento de Interesse Municipal”, according to Abrantes City Council Notice nº. 20/2014 of 11 April.

The building is located on the western edge of Largo General Avelar Machado. This location, in a  steeply sloping plot, determined some of the architect's design solutions, mentioned in the article “Que aspecto devemos dar às casas do Povo?” that was published in 1947 in the “Mensário das Casas do Povo: “with subjection to a terrain, which is ungrateful and quite difficult to take advantage of […] On the exterior, attention was paid to the local character of traditional buildings, so that what was done would not clash with the general appearance of the environment”

The main entrance to the building, in Largo General Avelar Machado, is protected by a porch of cylindrical columns featuring a wainscot of polychrome tiles. The two adjacent but distinct north-facing porches, the window lattices in the rooms on the south façade, the ceramic tile roof and the Portuguese-style eaves, the stone pinnacles on the roof and the chimneys are worthy of note.

Inside there is a ballroom with a stage, a reading room and three games rooms, as well as a kitchen with pantry and sanitary conveniences. The slope of the land was used to accommodate commercial premises and warehouses.

Raul Lino also designed the pedestal for the bust of General Avelar Machado, a prominent figure in Abrantes, which was inaugurated in 1929 in front of the Sociedade Assembleia de Abrantes Assembly Society building.

The main entrance to the building, in Largo General Avelar Machado, is protected by a porch of cylindrical columns featuring a wainscot of polychrome tiles. The two adjacent but distinct north-facing porches, the window lattices in the rooms on the south façade, the ceramic tile roof and the Portuguese-style eaves, the stone obelisks on the roof and the chimneys are worthy of note.
imagesSubtitle: Postcard of Assembleia de Abrantes building, (Arquivo Municipal Eduardo Campos, n.d.).
Main entrance porche of Sociedade Assembleia de Abrantes headquarter (2022)
South facade of Sociedade Assembleia de Abrantes headquarter (2022)

buildings.title: Residential Building, Constância
info: This project corresponds to a commission from Adriano Burguete for an economically built house, which should therefore dispense with ‘costly and in this case useless ornaments’ since ‘(...) the good effect therefore results only from the proportions, material and color of the whole work and, later - from its connection with the surrounding terrain by means of shrubs, climbing plants, etc.’.

Raul Lino refers a building with a balcony and porches, whose exterior walls, painted white or pink, should contrast with the green color of the wooden structures of the porches and the fixed window frames. In the design report, the movable part of the window frames and muntins are referred to as white.

As a cost-effective building, Raul Lino admits the use of concrete components (‘cast in cement’) to simulate traditional stonework elements, such as the thresholds, sills, porch columns and balcony half-posts, as these are more expensive. The architect uses the same argument to justify the exterior floor coverings in brick or terracotta. Lino also explains the integration of ‘local materials and building processes’ through the use of exposed pebbles in the porch and balcony walls. (Note: The sentences in quotation marks are quotes by Raul Lino; The quotes from Raul Lino were freely translated).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1924). Casa Unifamiliar, Constância. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 184.

buildings.title: Residential Building, Abrantes
info: This building takes as a starting point a pre-existing one and has undergone numerous renovations throughout its history.

The first intervention by Raul Lino dates from 1924 and consists of an extension in which the second floor and the attic were added in a similar style to the original building.  The compositional arrangement, symmetrical through the central axis was materialised by the balcony window bays, and features a lateral volumetry, with a subtle curvature with the entrance marked by a gate. Later, in 1942, Raul Lino designed the new configuration of the façade windows.

The exterior of the building is characterised by the shutters on the ground floor windows and the arched finishes in the access areas, as well as the colour of the shutters and entrance doors. Also noteworthy are the glass windows and the Portuguese-style eaves.
imagesSubtitle: Main facade of the building (2021)
Entrance door detail (2021)
Access area detail (2021)
Photo of the main facade (Arquivo Municipal Eduardo Campos, n.d.)

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1924). Casa Unifamiliar, Abrantes. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 198.
CMA/AMEC: Processo 10.5.3, 1942

buildings.title: Residential Building, Abrantes
buildings.typology: Single-family house (original plan from 1924; extension plan, 1948)
info: The building, originally designed in 1924, is located in a street on the edge of the historic centre and consists of a two-storey building with a basement positioned centrally.
On the ground floor are the social/public areas of the house, and on the first floor the private and intimate area which includes the bedrooms, other support compartments, and an oratory.

The main façade has a prominent central axis, adjoined by ashlar pilasters with a detached cornice topping the volume. Also, noteworthy the dormer window that also serves as the front in line with the building's main entrance, the small glass panel that are replicated in the upper part of the remaining straight-span glazing. The project details the metal bar railings, in little bars, for the balconies of the rear facade.

In 1948, an extension project was requested and a structure was erected in the plot adjacent to the existing building, which also underwent, as part of this campaign of works, some changes in room layout and distribution.
imagesSubtitle: Main facade (2021)
Entrance door (2021)
Main facade – Extension plan

buildings.title: Mausoleum, Cemetery of S. Miguel do Rio Torto
buildings.location: São Miguel do Rio Torto, Carvalhal
info: This building, located in the cemetery of S. Miguel do Rio Torto, was commissioned by the Martins family and built in 1924, according to the inscription engraved above the door. The building, with a simple composition, has portico, housing a small atrium, that precedes the chapel entrance, volumetrically detached and with a gabled roof.
imagesSubtitle: Entrance view of the mausoleum (2022).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1902-74). Projeto de mausoléu, Carvalhal, Abrantes. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 614.
LINO, R. (1927). Casa unifamiliar, Fátima. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 239.

buildings.title: Pedestal for the Bust of General Avelar Machado, Abrantes
info: In 1928, Raul Lino designed the pedestal for the bust of General Avelar Machado (1848-1909) by Ângelo Teixeira. The set was inaugurated in 1929 and is located in the square in front of the headquarters building of the Sociedade da Assembleia de Abrantes (the main entrance to this building).
imagesSubtitle: Inauguration of the bust of General Avelar Machado (1929).
View of the bust at Praça General Avelar Machado (2022).
View of the bust at Praça General Avelar Machado (2022).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1928). Monumento ao General Avelar Machado, Abrantes. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 244.

buildings.title: Residential Building, Abrantes
buildings.typology: Single-family house (original plan from 1929; extension plan, 1963)
info: The original plan for this residential building located near the Jardim da República in Abrantes was drawn up by Raul Lino in 1929. In 1963 (AMEC record is from 1959), an extension took place in the adjoining plot, which resulted in the construction of a separate building, maintaining the pre-existing façade composition and materials, and with a reinforced concrete structure.

On the ground floor, the main façade is covered with stone elements with regular cuts up to the windowsill. The entrance door is topped by stone elements that define a triangle. In the original plan, the roof included two formally distinct dormer windows, overlooking Rua Tenente Valadim.
imagesSubtitle: Main facade (2022).
Main facade (2022).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1929). Casa Unifamiliar, Abrantes. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 271.
CMA/AMEC: Processo nº 19, reg. 3396 de 1961.

buildings.title: Residential Building, Vila Nova da Barquinha
info: The project is for a single-family house commissioned by Eliseu Vieira da Cruz in 1930, and was built on uneven ground with a north-south orientation. The main entrance to the building faces north and is sheltered by a porch with cylindrical section ashlar pillars. The south facade includes a porch over a covered area with an arched structure that shields the rear entrance, located at a lower level than the main entrance.

The window frame has white movable elements in contrast to the green color of the fixed elements, which is common to the metal railings on the building's balconies. The building's windows are finished with tiny glasses.

The roof is covered with portuguese eaves with the underside of the tiles painted green, as is the side cladding of the dormers. The roof also features the upper corner finishes, with spheres and stone pinnacles, as well as the chimneys.
On the plot adjacent to this house, just a few meters away, another building was built symmetrically, based on the same project.
imagesSubtitle: View of main and east facade (2024).
Main facade (2024).
Detail from main facade (2024).
View of west facade (2024).
Fence wall detail (2024).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1929). Casa Unifamiliar, Praia do Ribatejo. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 277.

buildings.title: House, Torres Novas
info: The commission for this project came from Evaristo Matos Branco, who was a notary and mayor of Torres Novas between 1958 and 1962.
It is a three-storey building with an attic roof and includes a small chapel. On the main façade, faced east, a porch shelters the entrance to the house.

The first and second floors would correspond to the family compartments, with vertical communication ensured by a generously staircase. The ground floor, partly in the basement, due to the unevenness of the plot, has a lower ceiling height and is possibly used as a facility area. The detail drawings, related to the carpentry details - doors, panels, window frames - of the billiard rooms, dining room and drawing room, suggest that the house would include a relatively developed social/public reception area with specific spaces.

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1931). Casa Unifamiliar, Torres Novas. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 291.

buildings.title: Urban design, Sardoal
info: The “improvements of Sardoal”, as Raul Lino calls this set of urban-scale projects/interventions in various areas of the town, were commissioned by the Sardoal Town Council in 1933. According to the journal “Correio de Abrantes”, a year earlier, on 7 August 1932, Raul Lino visited the town invited by Manuel Serras Pereira, brother of the mayor Lúcio Serras Pereira.

There were identified four built projects: the reconstruction of the pillory, the fountainhead, the fence wall and gates of the old anti-tuberculosis center, and the pergola and ”Ramal Bellevue”. This last project was probably demolished in the 1980s [1].

In the town center, in Praça da República, next to the town hall, Raul Lino collaborated in the reconstruction of the old pillory, in the approximate location where there was a fountain – then moved closer to the old prison [3], having also designed the cobblestone pavement of the base in an octagonal shape. The pavement that surrounding the pillory base was designed with a geometric pattern, which has not been executed.

The commission for this work was recorded in 1933 council meeting: “The former pillory had been demolished (…) and this council decided to rebuild it using the scattered elements of the pillory that still exist, and based on the memories of people who saw it erected in its place, already quite dismantled, and in order not to lose a valuable historical monument, it commissioned the Chief Secretary of this council to sketch a design that would serve as a basis for its reconstruction. The architect Raul Lino perfected this design in its artistic details, so that the construction site could proceed with its execution without difficulty (…) with the stepped base of the pillory made  in Tomar stonework and the column in marble. (…) [2]
In the same square, the architect also designed a fountain, fitted on the raised walkway of Rua Monte do Sardoal.

At the beginning of Rua 5 de Outubro, Raul Lino had designed a long perimeter fence wall that runs alongside the plot of the former anti-tuberculosis establishment, with a simple masonry design with hollow triangular elements, and, in the design of the two gates, he included the figure of the sardão, a lizard that is represented in the town's arms.

IPA. 00002078 - Pelourinho

buildings.title: Transformer Substation Building, Alcanena
info: Transformation stations are structures usually in the form of a cabin or tower, in which medium-voltage electrical energy is transformed into low-voltage electrical energy for transmission through the network. In this transformer station building, designed in 1932, the architect presents a rectangular cross section tower, with interior access through a spiral staircase. Externally, the tower is topped with a pyramid-shaped roof, replicating the shape of some church bell towers roofs.

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1932). Distribuição de energia eléctrica em Alcanena, edifício do posto de transformação. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 325.

buildings.title: Transformer Substation Tower, Alcanena
info: This transformation tower was commissioned by Alcanena Town Council. The project description states that the Tourism and Propaganda Commissions had demanded greater integration of the buildings with the landscape. It was with this in mind that Raul Lino designed this technical tower, inspired by ‘traditional Portuguese ‘construction, but ‘using the modern process of building in reinforced concrete’ (Note: The sentences in quotation marks are quotes by Raul Lino; The quotes from Raul Lino were freely translated).
imagesSubtitle: 3D representation of the tower for the transformer substation, based on the project drawings.

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1932-34). Projeto de Torre para Posto de Transformação, 1932-34. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 298.

buildings.title: Urban Planning, Mação
buildings.location: Mação (This project has not been completed)
info: About the so-called “economic beautification plan” by Raul Lino, we only know the sketch that the architect presented in 1934. It refers to a perspective in which Raul Lino presents the possible urban arrangement of a square located on the edge of the town. The drawing proposes a belvedere framed by a pergola and, in the area of the square furthest back, next to the wall that limits it, should be placed a set of seats sheltered by a porch, in a nook softened by the construction of a fountain. In this project, the use of minimal elements is intended to create maximum effect, creating a mediation zone, an uncovered atrium, which would precede the entrance to the town.
imagesSubtitle: Probable location of the urban arrangement of Raul Lino that was not carried out: confluence between Rua da Ladeira and N3 (2024).
Probable location of the urban arrangement of Raul Lino that was not carried out: confluence between Rua da Ladeira and N3 (2024).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1934). Esboço de uma ideia para o Plano Económico de Embelezamento da Entrada da Vila de Mação Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 329.

buildings.title: Residential Buildind, Abrantes
info: Raul Lino's plan develops from an existing three-storey building located in the historic centre of Abrantes, in which the architect changed the composition of the third floor and converted the original single window opening into two. Two side openings were also added on the first and second floors, which in Raul Lino's project had a circular shape, but which were made into a rhombus (as evidenced by the current façade).
imagesSubtitle: Postcard Delcampe (c. 1957).
Side view of the building's main façade (2022).
Front view of the building's main façade (2022).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1935). Casa unifamiliar, Abrantes. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 342.

buildings.title: Residential Building, Abrantes
buildings.location: Rua General Manuel António Mourato, no. 11
info: This project by Raul Lino proposed the enlargement of a pre-existing ground floor building located in the old town of Abrantes in a narrow and deep plot. Two floors were added to the existing building connected by an interior staircase. The project for this building can be found in the Arquivo Municipal Eduardo Campos (local Archive) in Abrantes.
imagesSubtitle: Building’s façade on Rua General António Mourato (2022).

links.fonte: CMA/AMEC: processo nº 10.5.3-0Q0Q80/1934

buildings.title: Residential Building, Abrantes
info: The design of this building corresponds to a two-storey urban dwelling with an open loggia on the second floor, with a triple arcade overlooking Rua do Arcediago. This covered balcony has elements similar to those of the Sociedade da Assembleia de Abrantes Headquarters building (building 3), namely the arrangement of the ceramic elements of the railing, which are similar to those found in the chimney (building 3), and the circular arches and pillars of the balcony, which refer to the north-facing porch (building 3).
imagesSubtitle: Main façade of the building (2021).
Detail of the building's loggia (2021).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1935). Casa unifamiliar, Abrantes. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 340.

buildings.title: Residential Building, Abrantes
buildings.location: Rua de Santa Isabel no. 28 and no.30
info: Raul Lino's project started with an existing two-storey building (ground floor and upper floor) in downtown Abrantes to which one floor was added. The ground floor was intended for commercial premises and the upper floors for residential purposes.

According to the architectural design description, the exterior walls are made of solid brick, as are the interior partitions. The exterior walls are laid in one layer, while the interior walls are laid in half layers. The roof is described as ‘telhado de valadio’ (made of loose tiles) covered with Portuguese tiles, with cornice and eaves. (Note: The expressions in quotation marks are quotes by Raul Lino.).
imagesSubtitle: Main façade of the building (2021).
Entrance door to the building (2021).
Detail drawing of the roof of the building, included in the project elements, Arquivo Municipal Eduardo Campos (1936).

links.fonte: CMA/AMEC: processo nº 10.5.3-000062-1936

buildings.title: Residential Building, Abrantes
buildings.location: Rua Dom Afonso Henriques no. 9 and no. 11
info: In this project, Raul Lino is commissioned to design the renovation of an existing three-storey building with a tiled façade.  The plan includes a number of alterations inside the house, with the aim of adapting the interior spaces and improving its comfort and usability. On the outside, three dormer windows were added, two facing the patio and the other in the center of the main façade facing the street.
imagesSubtitle: Main façade of the building (2021).
Upper floors of the building's main façade (2021).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1939). Casa unifamiliar, Abrantes. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 423.
ROCHA, Mafalda (2019). Casa- Família(s): Vivências e Memórias as Intervenções de Raul Lino em Abrantes. Dissertação de Mestrado integrado da FAUP.

buildings.title: Residential Building, Abrantes
info: This building is a single-family house built in a rural area in Alferrarede. The main entrance porch with ceramic brick pillars, the glass windows, the Portuguese-style eaves and the chimney stand out.
imagesSubtitle: External view of the building (2021).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1939). Casa unifamiliar, Abrantes. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 386.
ROCHA, Mafalda (2019). Casa- Família(s): Vivências e Memórias as Intervenções de Raul Lino em Abrantes. Dissertação de Mestrado integrado da FAUP.

buildings.title: Garage, Abrantes
buildings.location: Rua Dom Afonso Henriques (next to no. 25)
info: This small project was for the construction of a garage in place of a pre-existing structure - a “shed”- close to the residential building that Raul Lino designed in 1924 for Guilherme Moura Neves, and which was later enlarged (in 1948). The project concerned the construction, on a narrow plot, of a garage to serve the dwelling. The unevenness of the terrain has made it possible to design outbuildings with separate accesses.

On the level of the street there is a garage, a bedroom and sanitary facilities, with access from the side façade. On the backyard level, there is also a volume housing two rooms, one for backyard storage and the other for a kitchen.
imagesSubtitle: Exterior view of the garage (2021).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1939). Projeto de uma garagem. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 404.
ROCHA, Mafalda (2019). Casa- Família(s): Vivências e Memórias as Intervenções de Raul Lino em Abrantes. Dissertação de Mestrado integrado da FAUP.

buildings.title: House, Abrantes
buildings.location: Rua Dom Afonso Henriques nº 13 a 15
buildings.typology: Single-family house (original project: 1939; alteration project to enlarge the existing building: 1941)
info: The project concerns the construction of a two-storey residential building with a basement in a markedly horizontal layout. The elevation is divided into four modules, with small differences between them. The entrance area stands out, integrating the door and window of the second floor in a vertical strip framed by pilasters.

In the building, it is worth noting the metal railings of the balconies (similar to the metal railings of the porch balcony of the Assembleia de Abrantes building), the stonework that marks the openings of the balcony windows and the doors, as well as the building's chimney.
imagesSubtitle: Main façade of the building (2021).
Detail on the main façade of the building (2021).
Main façade of the building, Arquivo Municipal Eduardo Campos (c. 1970).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1939). Casa unifamiliar, Abrantes. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 434.
ROCHA, Mafalda (2019). Casa- Família(s): Vivências e Memórias as Intervenções de Raul Lino em Abrantes. Dissertação de Mestrado integrado da FAUP.
CMA/AMEC: Processo 3149, 1942 e processo 3169, 1942

buildings.title: Residential Building, Abrantes
info: The alteration plan proposed by Raul Lino for this residential building located near the S. Vicente church and Largo da Ferraria includes important modifications such as the reconfiguration of its main façade with the removal of the balustrade and a new cornice ceiling. Dormer windows were also added and the frames, joinery and metalwork of the door and window frames were redesigned and replaced.
imagesSubtitle: Main facade of the building (2022).
Main entrance of the building (2022).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1940). Casa unifamiliar, Abrantes. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 422.

buildings.title: Kindergarten João de Deus 1
info: João de Deus de Nogueira Ramos (1830 - 1896), who became known as João de Deus, was an important Portuguese pedagogue and poet who is recognized for having proposed a method of teaching reading for children.

The first kindergarten, based on the methodology by João de Deus, was built in Coimbra in 1911. The project was designed by Raul Lino in 1909 and served as model for other buildings in different locations, as in Lisbon which building was inaugurated in 1915. Between 1911 and 1957 Raul Lino designed eleven kindergarten projects based on João de Deus methodology. Lino's work designing school spaces also included the Alcântara primary school (1916), the model 1 primary schools, North, Centre and South, in 1918; and the project types (1933-1935) for the Estado Novo primary schools to be built in the Portugues regions of Algarve, Alentejo, Ribatejo and Extremadura.

The construction of two kindergartens on João de Deus method in Tomar was part of the will of the benefactor Miguel Maria Ferreira (1871-1945). The donation in the form of money (worth 1,800 escudos) was announced to Tomar Town Council in 1945 by Miguel Ferrreira widow, Júlia Ferreira.

The first school was inaugurated on 9 January 1955 (building 26), in the urban expansion zone which resulted from the General Urbanization Plan for Tomar in 1942. Near the historic center, in Rua de Leiria, the second kindergarten opened in 1962 (building 27). João de Deus Ramos, the founder's son, who died in 1953, also supervised the project at an early stage.

The project, whose drawings have been deposited at the Calouste Gulbenkian Foundation, consists of two site plans, two elevations - front and back - construction details and a drawing of the perimeter wall relating to the Rua de Leiria project. Raul Lino's designs for this institution follow a model, with some variations. However, there are some constants, particularly in terms of the organization of the floor plan, with the entrance in a central position, usually with an arched opening that houses a generous covered area, and which communicates directly with the museum, the core of this type of school. To the side are the classrooms, canteen and other services.
imagesSubtitle: News published in the local press on June 28th in the newspaper “O Templário” (1953).
Main façade of the João de Deus kindergarten building in Tomar (2024).
Fachada principal do edifício do jardim de infância João de Deus, em Tomar (2024).
Main entrance to the João de Deus kindergarten building in Tomar (2024).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (195-460). Projecto de Jardim-Escola João de Deus, Tomar, projecto a realizar pelo legado do benemérito Miguel Maria Ferreira. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 473.
Lino, Raul (1916). Edifícios escolares de Raúl Lino”, revista Atlântida, nº 4, 15 de fevereiro de 1916, p. 331-336.
SGEC (2020). Raul Lino arquitecto de escolas. Organização Françoise Le Cunff

buildings.title: Family Burial Plot, Tomar
buildings.location: Cemetery of Santa Maria do Olival
info: Raul Lino, designer of João de Deus’ kindergarten buildings in Tomar (Buildings 26 and 27), which resulted from Miguel Maria Ferreira's legacy, was also responsible for designing the family burial plot of the benefactor. The building stands in the cemetery of Santa Maria dos Olivais. The project, dated from 1945, presented two compositional options, with the choice falling on a design with a classical composition, a tomb-chapel with a central body with two small wings in symmetry in lower height, and differentiated roof.
imagesSubtitle: Front view of the burial plot building of Miguel Maria Ferreira and Júlia Ferreira (2024).
Family burial plot of Miguel Maria Ferreira and his wife Júlia Ferreira: stamp of Raul Lino engraved on the façade (2024).
Side view of the burial plot building of Miguel Maria Ferreira and Júlia Ferreira (2024).

links.fonte: LINO, R. (1945). Projecto de jazigo da família da Exma. Sra. D. Júlia Ferreira, Tomar. Lisboa: Biblioteca de Arte da Fundação Calouste Gulbenkian, Espólio Raúl Lino: Cota RL 476.

buildings.title: Mansion, Abrantes
info: This nineteenth-century two-storey palace, whose main façade on the lower floor is covered with monochrome tiles, is located on one of the main arteries of Abrantes. This street connects the parish churches of S. Vicente and S. João Batista. In 1968, the interior was renovated by Raul Lino, with the garden project by architect Gonçalo Ribeiro Telles (1922-2020). In 1977, it was classified as property of municipal interest.
imagesSubtitle: Main façade of the building, Eduardo Campos Municipal Archive (n.d.).
Main façade of the building (2021).
